title: A Garamond clone? or ...? the 'T' looks like Caslon, but "C" like Granjon - its been driving me nuts, help!
content:
- Image in attachments -

Font: 

 Bespoke Build 

Solved By: 

 [kthomps5](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317142912/http:/typophile.com/user/175823 "View user profile.")

author: Glyphmon

comments.content:
Rongel comes close:  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/feliciano/rongel/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317142912/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/feliciano/rongel/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/feliciano/rongel/")

So does Arbesco  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/dtptypes/arbesco-dt/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317142912/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/dtptypes/arbesco-dt/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/dtptypes/arbesco-dt/")

Galliard was my first thought (which is based on Granjon), but I don't see much (if any) upward serif on the top of the T on your sample.

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/adobe/itc-galliard/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317142912/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/adobe/itc-galliard/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/adobe/itc-galliard/")
Sharing more information would make the search easier. That could be bespoke, exclusive for some newspaper...
thank you for the swift reply - I suspect its a modified version of Galliard.

To echo Ryuk, anyone reading this who wants a font ID please try and give some context as to the where and when of the sample.  
Don

Sure, I have added some more examples in attachment.

Its the typelogo of a very small run "article" magazine, I believe they've only done 3 issues. You can only find their magazines in certain shops.

The mysterious typeface is used throughout their magazine, so I now find it hard to imagine that each title is customised from Galliard.

I'm gonna post this anyway... and tell me where it's wrong...

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317142912im_/http:/typophile.com/files/tifes1_5275.jpg)

Sabon is nice, but its T and the R don't match the samples, and the two fonts I suggested don't appear to have a swash Q.

If it's a British publication, I'm guessing it's a UK foundry typeface; checking now....
Yes you're right, its a UK magazine I believe, thanks for helping!

Close (or not), but no cigar:  
Nikis Light, Eisner+Flake’s version of Kis by Hungarian Punchcutter Miklós Kis

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317142912im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Nikis%20Light_4269.jpg)

A few more that are almost there,  
DTL VandenKeere by Frank Blokland (1994)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317142912im_/http:/typophile.com/files/DTLVandenKeere_4429.gif)
  
 [http://www.dutchtypelibrary.nl/VandenKeere\_rdrct.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317142912/http:/www.dutchtypelibrary.nl/VandenKeere_rdrct.html "http://www.dutchtypelibrary.nl/VandenKeere\_rdrct.html")  
Van Dijck by Robin Nicholas (1935) 
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317142912im_/http:/typophile.com/files/VanDijckAsAnglo_6588.gif)
  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317142912im_/http:/typophile.com/files/VanDijckAsTides_4003.gif)
  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/mti/van-dijck/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317142912/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/mti/van-dijck/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/mti/van-dijck/")  
Custodia by Fred Smeijers 
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317142912im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Custodia_3924.gif)
  [https://ourtype.com/#/try/pro-fonts/custodia/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317142912/https:/ourtype.com/#/try/pro-fonts/custodia/ "https://ourtype.com/#/try/pro-fonts/custodia/")  
Don

Glyphmon, I can't seem to find a match.

Given that the magazine is a biannual and appears to be rather exclusive, I suspect it was a commissioned typeface.

EDIT: Mystery solved--it's a bespoke typeface by Colophon Foundry (from the online portfolio of Rosy Tsai, art director for ARTICLE):

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317142912im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Article_5966.png)
oh, fantastic find! Well done, sorry for the late reply was away at work! thank you everyone for the help!
